outputs.output_descr:
The project objective is to support the implementation of the Poverty Reduction Action Plan and the National Strategic Plan for HIV and AIDS, through capacity building of Government institutions and CSOs, with emphasis on HIV and AIDS mainstreaming. 

The project approach is to integrate HIV and AIDS in the strategies and plans of Government and CSOs organization as the most efficient way of address the challenges it poses, by training key people involved in planning process and senior managers as well as to make available the necessary tools and guidelines for integration. The project has 5 Outputs, namely:

•	Output 1:  HIV&AIDS mainstreaming knowledge resources (toolkits; guidelines etc) developed and capacities of target institution staff to use them established at central and local levels. 
•	Output 2: HIV & AIDS profiles developed (indicating the impact on personnel) and strategies integration in plans produced by selected institutions 
•	Output 3: An adequate network of local capacity-building facilitators established to support ongoing HIV & AIDS mainstreaming processes in the public and private sectors 
•	Output 4: HIV & AIDS mainstreaming institutionalized at in Education Institutions and a resource-centre and knowledge-sharing network established.
•	Output 5:  Functional monitoring and reporting on established mechanisms to monitor progress in HIV and AIDS integration (including budgeting

Effective minstreaming of gender  into  ministries, provincial and district governments, and municipalities  plans, budgets and  monitoring processes. At the end of the project it is expected that:  

1.Capacities of the National Council for the Advancement of Women (CNAM) strengthened in the areas of policy analysis, the provision of technical assistance, monitoring and reporting on the fulfilment of national and international commitments.
2.Guidelines on Gender Mainstreaming for technical staff and planners of selected sectors developed and published, and capacity of target users to use them established.
3.Gender assessments and mainstreaming plans produced by staff in selected key sectors.
4.Gender mainstreaming training effectively institutionalized within the civil service training system and one higher education institution.
5.An adequate network of local capacity-building facilitators established to support ongoing gender mainstreaming processes in the public sector.
6. Public Servants and CSO trained on mainstreaming of Gender and Domestic Violence

donor_name: UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT

project_descr: Strengthening Government and CSOs to integrate gender and HIV and AIDS in their strategies, programs and plans.
